alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 12:47AM EST until December 20 at 3:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and excessive rainfall runoff. The rain has ended but significant runoff will continue. * WHERE...A portion of western Maine, including the following counties, Franklin and Oxford. * WHEN...Until noon EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Turn around and don`t drown. Many roads are closed and washed out. Do not venture out tonight unless absolutely needed. There have been several water rescues due to people needlessly driving into flood waters. This makes the first responders` jobs unnecessarily more difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1247 AM EST, local law enforcement reported heavy rain and snowmelt in the warned area. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Farmington, Bethel, Rumford, Jay, Livermore Falls, Dixfield, Kingfield, Canton, Andover and Carrabassett Valley. - This includes the following Rec locations... Speckled Mountain, Old Speck Mountain, Saddleback Mountain, Sugarloaf Mountain, Mount Abraham, Grafton Notch, Evans Notch, Mount Blue, Caribou Mountain, Screw Auger Falls, Albany Mountain, Deer Hills, Goose Eye Mountain, Speck Pond, Table Rock, Mount Zircon, Baldpate Mountain, Old Blue Mountain, Bemis Mountain, Spaulding Mountain and Elephant Mountain.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
